content.question: Which of the following best explains a difference between European and South Asian migration during the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries?

choices.label: Unlike European migrants, South Asian migrants often served as indentured laborers.
European migrants often established enclaves in urban areas, whereas South Asian migrants intermixed with local populations.
European migrants often returned to their home societies, whereas South Asian migrants remained in their new countries.
Unlike European migrants, South Asian migrants often transplanted their culture into their new countries.

content.answer: Unlike European migrants, South Asian migrants often served as indentured laborers.

topic.text: 6.6: Causes of Migration in an Interconnected World

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
